entities: United Nations Assistance Mission for Iraq
summary:
The Security Council,
Recalling all its previous relevant resolutions, in particular resolution 1483 (2003) of 22 May 2003,
Reaffirming Iraq's sovereignty and territorial integrity, 
and the vital role of the UN in Iraq as set out in resolution 1483 (2003),
Having considered the Secretary-General's report of 15 July 2003 (S/2003/715),
 
1. Welcomes the establishment of the broadly representative Governing Council of Iraq on 13 July 2003, as a step towards an internationally recognized, representative government that will exercise Iraq's sovereignty;
2. Decides to establish the United Nations Assistance Mission for Iraq for 12 months to support the Secretary-General in fulfilling his mandate under resolution 1483 (2003) in accordance with his report;
3. Decides to remain seized of this matter.
